org.openpnp.machine.reference.driver

Class AbstractSerialPortDriver.SerialInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • org.openpnp.machine.reference.driver.AbstractSerialPortDriver.SerialInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Enclosing class:
    AbstractSerialPortDriver

    public class AbstractSerialPortDriver.SerialInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream
    Class that wraps a SerialPort to provide InputStream functionality. This stream also provides support for performing blocking reads with timeouts.
    It is instantiated by passing the constructor a SerialPort instance. Do not create multiple streams for the same serial port unless you implement your own synchronization.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SerialInputStream(SerialPort sp)
      Instantiates a SerialInputStream for the given SerialPort Do not create multiple streams for the same serial port unless you implement your own synchronization.

      • SerialInputStream

        public SerialInputStream(SerialPort sp)
        Instantiates a SerialInputStream for the given SerialPort Do not create multiple streams for the same serial port unless you implement your own synchronization.
        Parameters:
        sp - The serial port to stream.

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int time)
        Set the default timeout (ms) of this SerialInputStream. This affects subsequent calls to read(), #blockingRead(int[]), and #blockingRead(int[], int, int) The default timeout can be 'unset' by setting it to 0.
        Parameters:
        time - The timeout in milliseconds.

      • read

        public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the next byte from the port. If the timeout of this stream has been set, then this method blocks until data is available or until the timeout has been hit. If the timeout is not set or has been set to 0, then this method blocks indefinitely.
        Specified by:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public int read(int timeout)
         throws java.io.IOException
        The same contract as read(), except overrides this stream's default timeout with the given timeout in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The read byte.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On serial port error or timeout

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buf)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Non-blocking read of up to buf.length bytes from the stream. This call behaves as read(buf, 0, buf.length) would.
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer to fill.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read, which can be 0.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buf,
                int offset,
                int length)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Non-blocking read of up to length bytes from the stream. This method returns what is immediately available in the input buffer.
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer to fill.
        offset - The offset into the buffer to start copying data.
        length - The maximum number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        The actual number of bytes read, which can be 0.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error.

      • blockingRead

        public int blockingRead(byte[] buf)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Blocks until buf.length bytes are read, an error occurs, or the default timeout is hit (if specified). This behaves as blockingRead(buf, 0, buf.length) would.
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer to fill with data.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On error or timeout.

      • blockingRead

        public int blockingRead(byte[] buf,
                        int timeout)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        The same contract as blockingRead(byte[]) except overrides this stream's default timeout with the given one.
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer to fill.
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On error or timeout.

      • blockingRead

        public int blockingRead(byte[] buf,
                        int offset,
                        int length)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Blocks until length bytes are read, an error occurs, or the default timeout is hit (if specified). Saves the data into the given buffer at the specified offset. If the stream's timeout is not set, behaves as read(byte[], int, int) would.
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer to fill.
        offset - The offset in buffer to save the data.
        length - The number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error or timeout.

      • blockingRead

        public int blockingRead(byte[] buf,
                        int offset,
                        int length,
                        int timeout)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        The same contract as blockingRead(byte[], int, int) except overrides this stream's default timeout with the given one.
        Parameters:
        buf - The buffer to fill.
        offset - Offset in the buffer to start saving data.
        length - The number of bytes to read.
        timeout - The timeout in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On error or timeout.
